Class BusDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • entities.BusDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class BusDriver
extends java.lang.Thread
    Bus Driver thread and life cycle. It stores all relevant information about the BusDriver.

      • BusDriver

        public BusDriver(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> busSeats,
                 int TTL,
                 ArrivalQuay aq,
                 DepartureQuay dq)
        BusDriver Constructor. It initiates a new BusDriver thread.
        Parameters:
        busSeats - Maximum Number of Seats
        TTL - Time the bus driver waits before leaving the Arrival Quay.
        aq - Arrival Quay Shared Region
        dq - Departure Quay Shared Region

    • Method Detail

      • hasDaysWorkEnded

        public boolean hasDaysWorkEnded()
        Let's the BusDriver know his shift as ended, so he can enter terminal state.
        Returns:
        True, if the day has ended.

      • run

        public void run()
        BusDriver lifecycle

        While he is on is shift, the BusDriver follows a routine:

        First he announces the bus is available to board.

        When it's time to leave, he drives to the departure terminal.

        After parking he let's the passengers off and drives back to the Arrival Terminal.

        If his shift hasn't ended by then, he repeats.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
